keyPolicies.policyDescription: I will protect services in St. Mary's Hospital.
I will ensure Island schools are properly funded.
I will seek to introduce legislation to make sure our transport works for Islanders.
I will ensure the Island is at the forefront of Labour’s Green New Deal.
I will support a referendum on Labour’s improved Brexit deal.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Only Labour can beat the Tories on the Island.

issues.brexitEurope: support a referendum on Labour’s improved Brexit deal
issues.education: ensure Island schools are properly funded; making sure Island schools get the resources needed to provide first-rate education
issues.environment: ensure the Island is at the forefront of Labour’s Green New Deal
issues.health: protect services in St. Mary's Hospital; fight to ensure our NHS gets the funding it needs to protect the health and lives of Islanders
issues.transport: introduce legislation to make sure our transport works for Islanders; deliver an Island-wide transport strategy, beginning with ferries

community.content: I am extremely proud to be representing the Labour Party on the Isle of Wight in this election. This election provides Islanders, and the country, with a clearer choice than we have had in years.

leaflet.personalStatement: I have lived on the Isle of Wight for sixteen years. I run a successful business in Cowes, where I live with my family. I love the Island, its people and its communities, and I have been privileged to have been able to work with many Island community organisations.

quotes.text: As your Labour MP I will make sure all Island schools get the resources needed to provide a first-rate education for all of our children. I will deliver an Island-wide transport strategy, beginning with the ferries. I will ensure the Island obtains the full benefit of jobs and investment from Labour’s Green New Deal.

examples: 1st Tories 38,190 votes, 2nd Labour 17,121 votes, 3rd Greens 12,915 votes, 4th Lib Dems 2,740 votes
This is an election that will reshape the future of our country and the future of our Island. We can create a better future for our children.
a referendum on Labour’s improved Brexit deal
Labour can beat the Tories on the Island
protecting services at St. Mary's Hospital

personalStories.story: I have lived on the Isle of Wight for sixteen years. I run a successful business in Cowes, where I live with my family. I love the Island, its people and its communities, and I have been privileged to have been able to work with many Island community organisations.
